thread.title: BRIEF-Facebook Says Information Of Up To 87 Mln People May Have Been Shared With Cambridge Analytica

title: BRIEF-Facebook Says Information Of Up To 87 Mln People May Have Been Shared With Cambridge Analytica
text:
April 4, 2018 / 6:53 PM / Updated 24 minutes ago BRIEF-Facebook Says Information Of Up To 87 Mln People May Have Been Shared With Cambridge Analytica Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
April 4 (Reuters) - Facebook Inc: 
* BELIEVE FACEBOOK INFORMATION OF UP TO 87 MILLION PEOPLE, MOSTLY IN THE U.S., MAY HAVE BEEN IMPROPERLY SHARED WITH CAMBRIDGE ANALYTICA 
* STARTING APRIL 4, CO TO APPROVE ALL APPS REQUESTING ACCESS TO INFORMATION LIKE CHECK-INS, LIKES, PHOTOS, POSTS, VIDEOS, AMONG OTHERS 
* TO ALSO NO LONGER ALLOW APPS TO ASK FOR ACCESS TO PERSONAL INFORMATION LIKE RELIGIOUS OR POLITICAL VIEWS, NEWS READING, AMONG OTHERS 
* NEXT WEEK, CO TO REMOVE DEVELOPERâ€™S ABILITY TO REQUEST DATA PEOPLE SHARED WITH THEM IF IT APPEARS THEY HAVE NOT USED APP IN LAST 3 MONTHS 
* REVIEWED CALL & TEXT HISTORY FEATURE TO CONFIRM THAT CO DOES NOT COLLECT CONTENT OF MESSAGES, AND WILL DELETE ALL LOGS OLDER THAN 1 YEAR Source text: ( bit.ly/2GUOwLz ) Further company coverage:
